body.p: How does retained moisture result in skin rashes and other infections?

feedback.p: Correct. Bacteria and fungi require water to grow, so retained moisture provides optimal conditions for their survival. This can result in a variety of infections.
Incorrect. Moisture is not harmful to neutrophils.
Incorrect. Water promotes bacterial growth, which results in an increased immune response.
Incorrect. Passive immunity entails receiving preformed antibodies (i.e. from breastmilk), which does not occur naturally from bacterial infection.

hint.p: Consider the optimal growth conditions for foreign disease-causing agents.

body.p: When excess fat creates folds in the skin, what will happen to skin within the folds?

multiple_choice.choice: vitamin D deficiencies from lack of direct sunlight
large amounts of perspiration in this area
formation of a tumor within the skin fold

feedback.p: Correct. When sweat glands are obstructed, perspiration can get trapped within the layers of the skin. This results in germ build-up, which can cause a rash.
Incorrect. Although obesity has been linked to lower levels of vitamin D, this symptom is not caused by skin folds.
Incorrect. Sweat glands are obstructed because of the excess folds, resulting in a decreased amount of perspiration in this area.
Incorrect. It is highly unlikely that a tumor would form as a result of skin folds.

hint.p: The formation of folds in the skin results in obstruction of sweat glands.

body.p: Thinking about lung function, why would excess fat produce shallow breathing?

multiple_choice.choice: excess fat cells in the body require more oxygen. This increased demand makes breathing seem shallow
excess fat pushed down on the diaphragm, not allowing it to expand
less fluid production leads to less blood available for oxygen transport
alveoli become smaller, so less oxygen is transported throughout the body

feedback.p: Incorrect. While demand may be increased, the shallow breathing is a real symptom.
Correct. Excess fat does not allow the diaphragm to fully expand.
Incorrect. On the contrary, individuals with obesity tend to have greater amounts of blood than individuals of normal body mass.
Incorrect. Decreased size of alveoli is not a symptom of obesity.

hint.p: Sit up straight and take a deep breath. Now slouch and do the same. Do you notice a difference? If so, why?

body.p: Obesity hypoventilation syndrome is a condition caused by failure to breathe rapidly and/or deeply. How could this adversely affect the body?

feedback.p: Correct. Since obese individuals breathe less frequently than healthy ones, they have lower than normal blood oxygen levels.
Incorrect. Failure to breathe rapidly/deeply would result in high blood carbon dioxide levels.
Incorrect. Failure to breathe rapidly/deeply would not affect blood glucose levels.
Incorrect. Failure to breathe rapidly/deeply would require an increased heart rate in order to compensate for the decreased oxygen intake.

hint.p: Consider the gas exchange that occurs in the lungs.

body.p: Sleep apnea can disrupt regular sleep patterns. Given what you know about sleep patterns, what do you predict will be affected?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Although sleep apnea can make individuals feel irritable, there are other correct answer choices.
Incorrect. Although sleep apnea can result in difficulty concentrating and fatigue, there are other correct answer choices.
Incorrect. Although individuals suffering from sleep apnea tend to have more headaches, there are other correct answer choices.
Incorrect. Although sleep apnea can affect both mood and alertness, that is not all it can affect here.
All of the above - Correct. All of the above can be affected by sleep apnea.

hint.p: Imagine you have stayed up all night to write a term paper. How do you imagine yourself feeling the next day?

body.p: Chronic acid reflux can result in mucosal damage, which can lead to gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). The risk of GERD is substantially greater in obese individuals. Which of these obesity-related factors would cause this condition or cause it to worsen?

multiple_choice.choice: Putting excess pressure on the lower esophageal sphincter
The smooth muscle forming the upper esophageal sphincter degrades

feedback.p: Correct. Fatty foods take longer to digest, so acid production will occurs longer in the stomach. This increases the likelihood of reflux, especially if eaten close to bedtime.
Incorrect. Obesity increases inter-abdominal pressure, which increases the frequency of acid reflux.
Incorrect. This would not affect the tendency of stomach acid to travel into the esophagus.
Incorrect. The upper esophageal sphincter is located at the upper end of the esophagus.

hint.p: GERD is typically caused by changes in the barrier separating the stomach and esophagus.

body.p: If an obese individual also smokes cigarettes, how could smoking potentially worsen heartburn?

multiple_choice.choice: Lower esophageal sphincter function is impaired

feedback.p: Incorrect. While nicotine from cigarettes increases stomach acid production, there are additional ways smoking can worsen heartburn.
Incorrect. While saliva contains bicarbonate, which helps neutralizes stomach acid, there are additional ways smoking can worsen heartburn.
Incorrect. While nicotine in tobacco lowers pressure in the lower esophageal sphincter, there are additional ways smoking can worsen heartburn.
Correct. All of these are side-effects resulting from smoking that could worsen heartburn.

hint.p: Cigarettes contain nicotine, which can have numerous effects on the gastrointestinal system.

body.p: How does fat from the diet enter the bloodstream?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Fats are hydrophobic, and thus are not soluble in blood or water.
Correct. Lipoproteins have hydrophilic groups directed outward, and are able to transport lipophilic fats throughout the body in the blood.
Incorrect. Red blood cells only carry oxygen throughout.
Incorrect. Islet cells are located in the pancreas and produce glucagon, insulin, somatostatin, amongst other things.

hint.p: Fats are nonpolar and therefore hydrophobic.

body.p: Obesity results in a decrease in high density lipoproteins (HDL). How could this adversely affect an individual’s health?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Decreased HDL levels have been proven to result in an increased risk of heart disease. But this is not the only adverse affect listed here.
Incorrect. Decreased HDL levels have been proven to result in an increased risk of stroke. But this is not the only adverse affect listed here.
Incorrect. While obesity is correlated with an increased risk of diabetes, this is not a direct result of decreased HDL levels.
Incorrect. While obesity is correlated with an increased risk of cancer, this is not a direct result of decreased HDL levels.
Correct. Decreased HDL levels have been proven to result in both an increased risk of stroke and heart disease.
Incorrect. Decreased HDL levels have not been proven to result in all of these affects.

hint.p: HDLs are high in density and rich in protein.

body.p: Obesity is linked with greater resistance to insulin. How could this potentially result in a greater risk of breast cancer?

multiple_choice.choice: Insulin can trigger the growth of breast cancer cells.
Glucose in the bloodstream can trigger growth of breast cancer cells.
Medications used to treat insulin resistance can trigger growth of breast cancer cells.

feedback.p: Correct. Insulin resistance results in greater amounts of insulin in the bloodstream, which has been shown to trigger breast cancer.
Incorrect. It is high levels of insulin, not glucose, that are correlated with an increased rate of breast cancer.
Incorrect. High levels of insulin in the bloodstream are correlated with an increased rate of breast cancer.
Incorrect. Only high levels of insulin in the bloodstream are correlated with an increased rate of breast cancer.

hint.p: Levels of what hormone would increase following a resistance to insulin?

body.p: What causes the symptoms of dehydration and thirst in individuals with higher blood glucose levels?

multiple_choice.choice: Free glucose inhibits cells from absorbing water.
Cells require more water to produce glucagon.
Glucose increases osmotic pressure of the urine.

feedback.p: Incorrect. The presence of free glucose does not affect a cell’s ability to absorb water.
Incorrect. Glucagon is a hormone that raises blood glucose levels. Individuals with high blood glucose would release insulin, not glucagon.
Correct. Increased osmotic pressure in the urine reduces the kidney’s ability to reabsorb water. This leads to dehydration and increased thirst.
Incorrect. Only one of the above answer choices is responsible for the symptoms of dehydration and thirst in individuals with higher blood glucose levels.

hint.p: Consider the role of glucose in maintaining fluid/solute balance with the nephron.

body.p: Osteoarthritis can occur in individuals who engage in high risk sports and those who are sedentary but obese. Why is this?

multiple_choice.choice: increased synovial fluid from increased adrenaline production
increased synovial fluid production from increased load and use

feedback.p: Incorrect. This is not the only correct answer.
Incorrect. This is not the only correct answer.
Correct. Both situations can add strain and extra load on joints, which will lead to increased synovial fluid around the joint.

hint.p: Synovial fluid reduces friction between the cartilage of synovial joints during movement.

body.p: How else can obesity adversely affect the skeletal system?

feedback.p: Correct. Increased concentrations of uric acid in the body increase the risk of gout, a condition in which the joints become painful and inflamed.
Incorrect. This is a result of a vitamin C deficiency, which is required for proper collagen synthesis.
Incorrect. Obesity has not been shown to increase the risk of scoliosis.
Incorrect. There is only one correct answer choice above.

hint.p: Consuming large amounts of meats and fructose can raise the levels of uric acid in the body. How might this result in an adverse condition?

body.p: Which of the following are not causes of poor circulation?

multiple_choice.choice: High cholesterol levels in blood vessels

feedback.p: Incorrect. Hardening of the arteries makes it difficult for the blood to move from the heart to the extremities, such as the hands and feet.
Incorrect. High cholesterol levels could result in blood vessel constriction, resulting in obstruction of blood flow.
Incorrect. When blood clots form inside a blood vessel, the flow of blood through the body is obstructed.
Correct. This would result in vasodilation and would result in unobstructed blood flow.

hint.p: If blood vessels were to vasodilate, circulation would be unimpeded.
